title: How to Make a Nebula Jar

steps.headline: Set up your work space.
steps.description: Place down some newspaper, take the lid off of the jar, and make sure the paint is open.

steps.headline: Fill up about one third of the jar with water.
Put in a few drops of pink paint.
steps.description: Put the lid on and shake the jar until the paint is blended with the water.

steps.headline: Remove the lid and add some glitter (about a teaspoon).
Stretch out cotton balls, and put them in.
steps.description: Push them down until they fill up the paint water. Let the cotton balls soak up the water.

steps.headline: Fill up about another one third more with water.
steps.description: Add a few drops of the darkest color (less than you did for the pink). Do not shake the jar this time.

steps.headline: Stretch out some more cotton balls.
steps.description: Push them down carefully until they fill up the paint water. Let the cotton balls soak up the water.

steps.headline: Fill up the last third with water.
Add the purple if desired.
steps.description: Add some more glitter. Stretch out the cotton balls. Push the cotton balls down until they come almost to the top of the water, carefully.

steps.headline: Add a few drops of pink, stretch the cotton balls and push them to the glass instead of down (only if purple is desired).
steps.description: If purple isn't desired repeat step 10 with pink and don't push the cotton outwards. Add glitter.

text: Set up your work space. Place down some newspaper, take the lid off of the jar, and make sure the paint is open. Fill up about one third of the jar with water.  Put in a few drops of pink paint. Put the lid on and shake the jar until the paint is blended with the water. Remove the lid and add some glitter (about a teaspoon).  Stretch out cotton balls, and put them in. Push them down until they fill up the paint water. Let the cotton balls soak up the water. Fill up about another one third more with water. Add a few drops of the darkest color (less than you did for the pink). Do not shake the jar this time. Add more glitter.  Stretch out some more cotton balls. Push them down carefully until they fill up the paint water. Let the cotton balls soak up the water. Fill up the last third with water.  Add the purple if desired. Add some more glitter. Stretch out the cotton balls. Push the cotton balls down until they come almost to the top of the water, carefully. Add a few drops of pink, stretch the cotton balls and push them to the glass instead of down (only if purple is desired). If purple isn't desired repeat step 10 with pink and don't push the cotton outwards. Add glitter. Finished.
